#Text=Ramea
#Text=Ramea is a small island village in Southern Newfoundland .
#Text=In 2004 , Ramea was chosen as the site of a hybrid wind-diesel electricity generation project .
#Text=Understand
#Text=From 2011 to 2016 , its population fell from 526 to 447 .
#Text=Ramea sits on Northwest Island , one of a group of five major islands off the south coast of Newfoundland .
#Text=The island is approximately 3.14 km long by 0.93 km wide ( 1.95 miles by 0.58 miles ) .
#Text=The remaining major islands in the archipelago are Great ( or Big ) Island , Middle Island , Harbour Island , and South West Island .
#Text=Ramea is home to a lot of plants , which include the purple pitcher plant and bakeapple .
#Text=The island and surrounding islands serve as a fall and winter home to many migratory seabirds .
#Text=History
#Text=The community was settled in the early 19th century for its proximity to rich fishing grounds and safe anchorages .
#Text=It became a thriving fishing village .
#Text=It was probably named for Le Ramée , a street in Saint Peter Port , the capital of Guernsey .
#Text=From 1949 to 1970 , businesswoman Marie Penny owned and operated John Penny & Sons , one of the largest frozen fish companies in Newfoundland during the 20th century .
#Text=Since the cod moratorium of 1992 , the isolated community has struggled to survive , having declined from a peak population of 1,120 in the 1970s .
#Text=Wind energy
#Text=In 2004 , Ramea was chosen for the site of Canada 's first wind-diesel demonstration project .

#Text=Six 65 kW wind turbines were installed on the island to demonstrate that the Wind-Diesel Integrated Control System can be used to displace diesel power generation by introducing wind to the island 's grid and to show significant energy efficiency and reliability for northern , remote or isolated locations .
#Text=The wind-diesel pilot program generates around 1 million kWh/yr and offsets approximately 750 tonnes of emissions annually .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Ramea is accessible via the Provincial Ferry Service , from either Burgeo or Grey River .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The Ferry from Burgeo to Ramea is capable of carrying vehicles , and there are roads in Ramea for cars .
#Text=The relatively small size ( 1.89 km ) of the town , however , means that any destination is within walking distance .
#Text=MV Gallipoli , toll-free : +1-888-638-5454 .

#Text=Provincial ferry , two or three runs daily depart Burgeo ( on Route 480 ) to the island community of Ramea ( 1½ hours ) , and a few Tuesday and Thursday runs continue onward to Grey River ( 3 hours ) .
#Text=One-way : adult $ 6 ; child , student or senior $ 3.25 , vehicle $ 11 .
#Text=See
#Text=Operational wind-diesel generation plant
#Text=Northwest Head
#Text=Lighthouse , one of the last remaining staffed lighthouses in Canada
#Text=Ramea Heritage Centre , 5 Church Street .
#Text=The local museum full of artifacts .
#Text=Do
#Text=Hike :
#Text=there are several hiking paths , including one that takes hikers on a circuit around the island and to the wind-diesel plant .
#Text=Walking to the island 's highest point on top of Man O'War Hill offers excellent views of archipelago and across to White Bear Bay .
#Text=Music : Every year the islands plays host to a Rock Island Music Festival of traditional music on the second weekend of August .

#Text=Local bands , outdoor bingo , hot turkey supper prepared by the Ladies Auxiliary , kids ' games hosted by the the Wolf Cubs ( junior Boy Scouts ) , adult dance , casserole dinner , Sunday brunch after church .
#Text=So , it 's not just the music that 's traditional ...
#Text=Eastern Outdoors , 2 Main St. , ☏ +1709 625-2522 , ✉ info@easternoutdoors.com .
#Text=8AM-5PM .
#Text=Provides guided tours of the island , including kayak tours .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Beachside Store , 18-20 Beach Rd , ☏ +1709 625-2468 .
#Text=M - Sa 9AM-9PM .
#Text=Convenience store
#Text=Eat
#Text=Eastern Outdoors ’ Ramea Retreat Restaurant ( across from the ferry terminal ) , ☏ +1709 625-2522 .
#Text=Short order cooking , home cooked meals , snacks and beverages .
#Text=Community events such as Sunday dinners , BBQ nights , Movie and Pizza nights for kids .
#Text=Drink
#Text=There is a liquor store on Main St at Lodge Rd , west of the ferry dock .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Ramea Retreat ( Eastern Outdoors ) , 2 Main St , ☏ +1709 625-2522 .
#Text=The Lodge ’s facilities also include a 10 bed hostel , a common room with cable TV and high speed internet access as well as full bathroom and laundry facilities for travellers and sailors .
#Text=Dorms $ 39 , private rooms $ 89 , houses $ 195 .
#Text=Connect
#Text=There is a post office opposite the ferry dock .
